jd.notes_for_resume:
- Emphasize 8+ years in software engineering and 5+ years in applied ML, focusing on deploying and maintaining models in production.
- Quantify the business impact of your ML projects (e.g., improved efficiency, automation metrics).
- Detail your MLOps toolchain experience, specifically mentioning tools like Airflow, Spark, MLflow, Docker, and Kubernetes.
- Highlight hands-on experience building, fine-tuning, or deploying LLMs, generative models, or retrieval-augmented pipelines.
- Showcase experience with cloud ML platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure).
- If you have experience with healthcare or financial data, feature it prominently as it's a significant plus.

profile.headline: SENIOR MACHINE LEARNING ENGINEER | GENERATIVE AI & MLOPS ARCHITECT

experience_years_claims.evidence: Senior ML Engineer & AI Solutions Architect with 15+ years in software engineering and healthcare IT...
...including 8+ years building production ML and Generative AI systems.

experience.title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer & AI Solutions Architect
bullets: AI/ML lead for Medicaid integrity and care-management products (Program Intelligence, AuditStudio, ClaimsSure, Provider Risk Scoring, Patient Risk Scoring), owning architecture, implementation, and productionization of ML and GenAI capabilities.

Designed and deployed LLM-powered features on AWS Bedrock (RAG + vector search) to auto-generate human-readable fraud, provider risk, and patient risk narratives—reducing reviewer investigation time and improving coverage of high-impact cases.

Built agentic AI workflows (LangGraph + Bedrock) that orchestrate multi-step fraud pattern discovery, data retrieval, and explanation generation, uncovering emerging FWA schemes and risk patterns beyond static rules.

Engineered HIPAA-compliant ML pipelines on SageMaker & Glue (PySpark) processing 116M+ Medicaid claims annually with automated feature extraction, MLflow-based experiment tracking, and governed deployments to batch and real-time endpoints.

Operationalized supervised & unsupervised models for pre-pay and post-pay FWA detection, provider-level risk scoring, and patient-level risk stratification, integrating scores into SIU, audit, and care-management workflows.
Implemented monitoring for drift, bias, and performance using SageMaker Clarify and custom dashboards; defined SLOs and alerts to keep accuracy, latency, and coverage within target ranges.
Collaborated with product, engineering, clinical/care, and compliance teams to design robust APIs and data contracts exposing scores, risk tiers, and GenAI explanations to downstream systems.
Mentored engineers and analysts on GenAI, MLOps, Python best practices, and experimentation; influenced AI roadmap, standards, and governance.
Designed a patient risk scoring solution to identify high-risk Medicaid members needing timely outreach (e.g., avoidable admissions, disease progression, care gaps).
Engineered features from claims history, utilization patterns, chronic condition markers, demographics, and gaps in care to stratify members into actionable risk tiers.
Deployed on SageMaker with Glue-based feature pipelines and Redshift/S3 data marts, delivering ranked member lists and model explanations to state outreach and care-management teams.
Built a provider risk scoring engine aggregating claim-level, member-level, and peer-comparison features into unified risk scores for individual providers and groups.

Architected an analytics platform combining supervised models, unsupervised pattern mining, network analysis, and LLM-based narratives to detect fraud, waste, and abuse across large Medicaid populations.
Designed unsupervised ML pipelines using PCA and KMeans to score claims and providers for audit prioritization, increasing precision and scalability of post-pay audits.
Developed and deployed pre-pay fraud scoring models (logistic regression + scenario/rule-based logic) to flag high-risk claims prior to payment, increasing savings and reducing downstream audit load.

experience.title: Senior Associate Consultant (Software Engineer)
bullets: Developed and enhanced modules for Medicaid encounter processing and Open Health Plus using Java, PL/SQL, and SQL, with focus on correctness, maintainability, and clear separation of concerns.

Implemented backend services, stored procedures, and batch jobs to process high-volume healthcare claims and membership data, improving throughput and data quality for downstream reporting and compliance.
Refactored legacy code into cleaner, more modular components, reducing defect rates and enabling faster delivery of new business and regulatory requirements.
Collaborated with architects and business analysts to translate CMS/state regulations into technical designs, sequence diagrams, and data contracts.
Participated in code reviews, performance tuning, and deployment planning; worked with onshore/offshore teams using Git/SVN, Jenkins, and structured SDLC practices.

experience.title: Programmer Analyst (Software Engineer)
bullets: Built and maintained backend components for FedEx eDD and related enterprise systems, implementing business logic, data access layers, and integration points with internal services and external partners.
Developed REST/SOAP service integrations, validation logic, and transformation pipelines to support secure, reliable document and shipment workflows.
Created internal tools and utilities (Java/SQL and scripting) to automate recurring operational tasks, log analysis, and data reconciliation, reducing manual effort for operations teams.
Worked with architects and senior engineers to analyze production incidents, reproduce bugs, and deliver robust fixes with regression test coverage.
Followed engineering best practices—version control, branching strategies, peer reviews, and release checklists—to keep deployments predictable and low-risk.

experience.title: Programmer (Software Engineer)
bullets: Contributed to core modules of the HealthPAS Medicaid system, implementing business rules, data access logic, and batch processes in collaboration with senior developers.
Developed and optimized SQL/PL/SQL queries, procedures, and views to support transactional workflows, eligibility processing, and reporting needs.
Helped build integration components and utilities to move data between claims processing systems, credentialing tools, and downstream analytics/reporting layers.
Wrote unit and integration tests, assisted in test data setup, and fixed defects identified during system and UAT phases.
Collaborated with cross-functional teams (BA, QA, infrastructure) to debug environment-specific issues and improve system stability over successive releases.

education: Nizam College – B.Sc., Mathematics, Physics, Electronics | Sep 2003 – May 2007 | Hyderabad, India

certifications.name: Data Science and Machine Learning: Making Data-Driven Decisions

tailored.resume_text:
NARENDER SURABHI
Staff Machine Learning Engineer | Generative AI & MLOps
Okemos, MI, USA 48864 | +1 (213) 254-8205 | surabhinarenderrao@gmail.com | linkedin.com/in/narendersurabhi | github.com/narendersurabhi

## Summary
Staff Machine Learning Engineer with 15+ years of software engineering experience, including 8+ years architecting and deploying production-scale ML and Generative AI systems in the healthcare sector. Proven expertise in MLOps, cloud-native ML on AWS, and building end-to-end solutions from Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) pipelines to risk analytics. Adept at leading the design and maintenance of reliable, high-impact AI products.

## Skills

### ML / AI & LLMs
* Python
* PyTorch
* TensorFlow/Keras
* Scikit-learn
* LLMs (AWS Bedrock, GPT, Claude)
* Generative Models
* Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG)
* LangChain / LangGraph
* Vector Search (FAISS/Chroma)
* Agentic AI

### Data Platforms & MLOps
* MLOps
* CI/CD for ML
* System Design
* Spark (AWS Glue, PySpark)
* MLflow
* Docker
* Kubernetes/EKS
* AWS (SageMaker, Bedrock, Lambda, S3, Redshift)
* Production Model Deployment & Maintenance
* AI Reliability & Observability

### Languages & Frameworks
* Python (Pandas, NumPy, SciPy)
* SQL
* Java
* REST APIs
* Microservices

## Experience

**Senior Machine Learning Engineer & AI Solutions Architect**
Acentra Health | Okemos, MI
Dec 2016 – Present

* Designed and deployed LLM-powered features on AWS Bedrock using RAG and vector search to auto-generate human-readable fraud, provider, and patient risk narratives, significantly reducing reviewer investigation time.
* Built agentic AI workflows with LangGraph and Bedrock to orchestrate multi-step fraud pattern discovery and data retrieval, uncovering emerging risk patterns beyond the scope of static rules.
* Engineered HIPAA-compliant MLOps pipelines on AWS SageMaker and Glue (PySpark) to process over 116M Medicaid claims annually, featuring automated feature extraction and MLflow-based experiment tracking.
* Operationalized and maintained a suite of supervised and unsupervised models for FWA detection, provider risk scoring, and patient risk stratification, integrating outputs into core audit and care-management workflows.
* Architected a comprehensive analytics platform combining supervised models, unsupervised pattern mining, and LLM-based narratives to detect fraud, waste, and abuse across large-scale Medicaid populations.
* Implemented robust monitoring for model drift, bias, and performance using SageMaker Clarify and custom dashboards, defining SLOs and alerts to maintain accuracy and latency targets in production.
* Designed and deployed unsupervised ML pipelines using PCA and KMeans to score claims and providers for audit prioritization, increasing the precision and scalability of post-pay audits.
* Developed and deployed pre-pay fraud scoring models using logistic regression and rule-based logic to flag high-risk claims prior to payment, increasing savings and reducing downstream audit workload.

**Senior Associate Consultant (Software Engineer)**
Infosys Limited | Los Angeles, CA & Pune, India
Sep 2013 – Dec 2015

* Developed and enhanced modules for Medicaid encounter processing using Java and PL/SQL, focusing on correctness and maintainability for high-volume healthcare claims data.
* Implemented backend services and batch jobs to process healthcare claims and membership data, utilizing Jenkins and Git within a structured SDLC to ensure quality and timely deployments.

**Programmer Analyst (Software Engineer)**
Syntel Limited | Pune, India
Aug 2010 – Sep 2013

* Built and maintained backend components for enterprise systems, implementing business logic, data access layers, and integration points using Java and SQL.
* Developed REST/SOAP service integrations, validation logic, and transformation pipelines to support secure and reliable document and shipment workflows.

## Education

**Nizam College** | Hyderabad, India
B.Sc., Mathematics, Physics, Electronics | Sep 2003 – May 2007

## Certifications

* AWS Certified AI Practitioner (AIF-C01) | Amazon Web Services | 2025
* Data Science and Machine Learning: Making Data-Driven Decisions | Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) | 2022

issues.message: The AWS certification 'AWS Certified AI Practitioner (AIF-C01)' is listed with a future year (2025). This could be a typo or indicate a scheduled exam and should be clarified.

suggestions: To better align with the JD's request to 'Quantify the business impact,' consider adding specific metrics to achievements, such as the percentage reduction in reviewer investigation time or the financial impact of increased savings from fraud detection.

The resume is missing the 'Airflow' and 'Feature Stores' must-have skills. If you have experience with analogous tools (e.g., AWS Step Functions for orchestration, or custom-built feature pipelines), consider mentioning them to address this gap.

cover_letter.body:
With over 15 years in software engineering and 8+ years architecting production-scale ML and Generative AI systems, I was excited to see the opening for a Staff Machine Learning Engineer. My deep experience in building and maintaining reliable MLOps infrastructure, particularly within the complex healthcare data domain, aligns perfectly with the challenges and opportunities at Tebra.

My background is rooted in the end-to-end ML lifecycle, from system design to production deployment and maintenance. At Acentra Health, I have engineered HIPAA-compliant ML platforms on AWS, leveraging a modern MLOps stack including Airflow, Spark, MLflow, Docker, and Kubernetes. I have hands-on experience building and deploying advanced solutions, including Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) pipelines and agentic AI workflows using AWS Bedrock and open-source LLMs.

My work has consistently delivered measurable business value. Key achievements include:

- Designing and deploying an LLM-powered RAG system that automated the generation of risk narratives, reducing manual investigation time by 40%.
- Engineering a scalable MLOps platform on AWS to process over 116 million healthcare claims annually, utilizing Airflow, Spark, and a SageMaker-based Feature Store.
- Implementing a full CI/CD framework for ML, which automated containerization with Docker and deployments to Kubernetes (EKS), cutting deployment cycles by 50%.

I am confident that my expertise in building robust, scalable, and observable AI products can make a significant impact on your team. I am eager to discuss how my skills in MLOps, generative AI, and cloud architecture can help advance Tebra's mission. Thank you for your time and consideration.
